title: 2011 International Origin series
text:
The 2011 International Origin series is the first time the <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> <a href="International%20Origin">International Origin</a> has been played. This series was just a one-off match between <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> and <a href="Exiles%20rugby%20league%20team">Exiles RL</a> to give England a good opposition mid-season in preparation for the <a href="2011%20Four%20Nations">2011 Four Nations</a> in November.
International Origin Match.
<a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> side consisted of 16 players who had played internationally for England or <a href="Great%20Britain">Great Britain</a> in the past but handed a debut to <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> hooker <a href="Michael%20McIlorum">Michael McIlorum</a> who started on the bench. Whilst <a href="Jamie%20Jones-Buchanan">Jamie Jones-Buchanan</a> from <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> was the 18th man.
The Exiles coach <a href="Brian%20McLennan">Brian McLennan</a> had originally picked <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> centre <a href="Matt%20King%20%28rugby%20league%29">Matt King</a> in his starting line-up but due to King wanting to witness the birth of his child McLennan moved <a href="Sia%20Soliola">Sia Soliola</a> from the second-row to centre, with <a href="Louis%20Anderson">Louis Anderson</a> coming off the bench to start at second row, this allowed <a href="Glenn%20Morrison">Glenn Morrison</a> (the 18th man) to start on the bench.
1st Half
<a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a>’s powerful second-rower <a href="Willie%20Manu">Willie Manu</a> provided the first try for the Exiles after <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> <a href="Thomas%20Leuluai">Thomas Leuluai</a> carved up the English defence and offloaded the ball. Winger <a href="Pat%20Richards">Pat Richards</a> provided the conversion. England soon hit back with prop <a href="James%20Graham%20%28rugby%20league%29">James Graham</a> making a half break before offloading the ball to <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> scrum half <a href="Richie%20Myler">Richie Myler</a> to sprint 35 metres to score, <a href="Kevin%20Sinfield">Kevin Sinfield</a> added the extras.
The Exiles were to strike next on the scoreboard though, some neat interplay from <a href="Rangi%20Chase">Rangi Chase</a>, <a href="George%20Carmont">George Carmont</a> and <a href="Glenn%20Morrison">Glenn Morrison</a> saw the Exiles go 55 metres in one play down the left before Leuluai found <a href="Brett%20Hodgson">Brett Hodgson</a> in the centre of the field who provided a nice cross field kick into the arms of <a href="Tony%20Puletua">Tony Puletua</a> who simply tapped it infield to <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St Helens R.F.C.</a> team mate <a href="Francis%20Meli">Francis Meli</a> who had the easiest of scores.
2nd Half
However with 10 minutes to go <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> second-rower <a href="Joel%20Tomkins">Joel Tomkins</a> intercepted a pass on his own 10 metre line and raced nearly the length of the field to score a try, Sinfield once again added the extras to put England into a 12-10 lead. But with a minute left on the clock, Chase offloaded a ball to Puletua who gave a pass to Carmont, Carmont then stepped inside to score the decisive try, Richards converted to give the Exiles their first International Origin win. Exiles stand-off <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> <a href="Rangi%20Chase">Rangi Chase</a> was the Man of the Match.
Teams.
Exiles RL.
The Exiles team originally was supposed to have <a href="Matt%20King%20%28rugby%20league%29">Matt King</a> lining up at centre however due to his baby's birth he withdrew himself in the week preceding the match allowing <a href="Iosia%20Soliola">Iosia Soliola</a> to move into the centre, <a href="Louis%20Anderson">Louis Anderson</a> to second-row and <a href="Glenn%20Morrison">Glenn Morrison</a> onto the bench.
